definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: The crowd eddied about in the market place.
I feel the tears burn behind my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得泪水就在眼眶里打转。

sentences.english: In the meantime, the protesters are still milling about.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，抗议者还在原地打转。

sentences.english: Come out for a walk instead of moping around in the house.
sentences.chinese: 别在房里垂头丧气地打转，出来散散步吧。

sentences.english: The mist eddied round the old castle.
sentences.chinese: 薄雾在那座古老的城堡的周围打转转。

sentences.english: Mengdie voice choking a bit, two drops of tears in her eyes around.
sentences.chinese: 梦蝶声音有点哽咽，两滴泪珠在她眼中打转。

sentences.english: At summer night, the sound of cicadas is around him, a moth spinning ceaselessly. Mr.
sentences.chinese: 夏天的夜晚，周围都是蝉鸣，一只蛾子在不停地打转。

sentences.english: The wind was falling about the building.
The vessel swings by her moorings.
I just love him, when you said in the play, the tears filled with eye socket.
sentences.chinese: 我只爱他，当你在剧中这样说道，眼泪在眼眶里打转。

sentences.english: If one wheel of a cart is big and the other one is small, the cart can not move forward.
sentences.chinese: 推车的双轮若是一大一小，就只能在原地打转。

sentences.english: His eyes do not grow bright or roll;
A shopping mall swirls around the corpse of a beetle.
sentences.chinese: 购物中心围着甲虫的尸体打转。

sentences.english: Setup your lifestyle so it revolves around money.
sentences.chinese: 建立自己的生活方式，围着金钱打转。

sentences.english: By this time the tide was beginning to ebb, and the ship was swinging round to her anchor.
sentences.chinese: 这时，潮水开始退了，大船在绕着锚打转儿。
他们的确一直在原地打转。

definition: to rove around/to run around in circles/to walk back and forth
to rotate/to twirl/to run around/to encircle/rotation/(coll.) to speak indirectly/to beat about the bush
whirling/spinning around and around/round and plump (e.g. of fruit)
to shake (a part of one's body)/to shrug (shoulders)/to create a sensation/to incite
to spin rapidly/to whirl around/(of time) to fly by
to roll/to wander around/to appear repeatedly
to rotate (about an axis)/to revolve/to turn/to move in a circle/to gyrate
